resource.name: Listing of Active Businesses
resource.description:
Listing of all active businesses currently registered with the Office of Finance. An "active" business is defined as a registered business whose owner has not notified the Office of Finance of a cease of business operations. Update Interval: Monthly.

NAICS Codes are from 2007 NAICS:
https://www.census.gov/cgi-bin/sssd/naics/naicsrch?chart=2007
columns_description: Zip code of the business location.
The start date of the first business activity registered at this location.
The council district # reflects the current council district assignment for that location address. "0" means the business location is out of the City.
Description of the primary NAICS code. Descriptions that are noted as "(1997 NAICS)" apply the code and description designated in 1997 as referred to in the New Business Exemption Ordinance.
The self-reported North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code, which is used in classifying business establishments.
Mailing address city of the business.
Mailing address of the business.
Abbreviated address description of the business location.
City of the business location.
Street address of the business location.
Doing Business As (DBA) name. If more than one DBA name exists, then all names are shown as a pipe-separated list.
The legal name of the business.
Mailing address Zip code of the business.
Latitude & Longitude, if present, for this business location.
The most recent end date of all business activities at the location.
The account number of the business location.

resource.name: Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) - Parking Lots Current Status
resource.description:
Displays parking information capacity live.
Information on Parking lots; 1, 2A, 2B, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, C.
Data is updated every five minutes
columns_description: Parking lot name
Longitude
Free Spaces = [TotalParkingSpaces] – [Occupied]
Internal parking lot key value
External parking lot ID
Total current spaces occupied
Parking lot description
% of spaces occupied
Total available parking spaces (this is a static number and may not represent actual available spaces)
Latitude
Data export from source system
Color indicator to indicate % occupied

domain_tags: parking realtime status lax lawa airport

resource.name: Crime Data from 2020 to Present
resource.description:
***Starting on March 7th, 2024, the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) will adopt a new Records Management System for reporting crimes and arrests. This new system is being implemented to comply with the FBI's mandate to collect NIBRS-only data (NIBRS — FBI - https://www.fbi.gov/how-we-can-help-you/more-fbi-services-and-information/ucr/nibrs).
During this transition, users will temporarily see only incidents reported in the retiring system. However, the LAPD is actively working on generating new NIBRS datasets to ensure a smoother and more efficient reporting system. ***

******Update 1/18/2024 - LAPD is facing issues with posting the Crime data, but we are taking immediate action to resolve the problem. We understand the importance of providing reliable and up-to-date information and are committed to delivering it.

As we work through the issues, we have temporarily reduced our updates from weekly to bi-weekly to ensure that we provide accurate information. Our team is actively working to identify and resolve these issues promptly.

We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your understanding. Rest assured, we are doing everything we can to fix the problem and get back to providing weekly updates as soon as possible. ****** 


This dataset reflects incidents of crime in the City of Los Angeles dating back to 2020. This data is transcribed from original crime reports that are typed on paper and therefore there may be some inaccuracies within the data. Some location fields with missing data are noted as (0°, 0°). Address fields are only provided to the nearest hundred block in order to maintain privacy. This data is as accurate as the data in the database. Please note questions or concerns in the comments.
columns_description: Longtitude
Street address of crime incident rounded to the nearest hundred block to maintain anonymity.
May contain a code for an additional crime, less serious than Crime Code 1.
Status of the case. (IC is the default)
Defines the Premise Code provided.
Two character numeric
Defines the Crime Code provided.
The LAPD has 21 Community Police Stations referred to as Geographic Areas within the department. These Geographic Areas are sequentially numbered from 1-21.
Latitude
Cross Street of rounded Address
Defines the Weapon Used Code provided.

A four-digit code that represents a sub-area within a Geographic Area. All crime records reference the "RD" that it occurred in for statistical comparisons. Find LAPD Reporting Districts on the LA City GeoHub at http://geohub.lacity.org/datasets/c4f83909b81d4786aa8ba8a74a4b4db1_4
The type of structure, vehicle, or location where the crime took place.

The 21 Geographic Areas or Patrol Divisions are also given a name designation that references a landmark or the surrounding community that it is responsible for. For example 77th Street Division is located at the intersection of South Broadway and 77th Street, serving neighborhoods in South Los Angeles.

Modus Operandi: Activities associated with the suspect in commission of the crime.See attached PDF for list of MO Codes in numerical order. https://data.lacity.org/api/views/y8tr-7khq/files/3a967fbd-f210-4857-bc52-60230efe256c?download=true&filename=MO%20CODES%20(numerical%20order).pdf
Indicates the crime committed. (Same as Crime Code 1)
MM/DD/YYYY
Division of Records Number: Official file number made up of a 2 digit year, area ID, and 5 digits
The type of weapon used in the crime.
In 24 hour military time.
May contain a code for an additional crime, less serious than Crime Code 1.
May contain a code for an additional crime, less serious than Crime Code 1.
Indicates the crime committed. Crime Code 1 is the primary and most serious one. Crime Code 2, 3, and 4 are respectively less serious offenses. Lower crime class numbers are more serious.

Descent Code: A - Other Asian B - Black C - Chinese D - Cambodian F - Filipino G - Guamanian H - Hispanic/Latin/Mexican I - American Indian/Alaskan Native J - Japanese K - Korean L - Laotian O - Other P - Pacific Islander S - Samoan U - Hawaiian V - Vietnamese W - White X - Unknown Z - Asian Indian
MM/DD/YYYY
Defines the Status Code provided.
F - Female M - Male X - Unknown

resource.name: Arrest Data from 2010 to 2019
resource.description: This dataset reflects arrest incidents in the City of Los Angeles from 2010 to 2019. This data is transcribed from original arrest reports that are typed on paper and therefore there may be some inaccuracies within the data. Some location fields with missing data are noted as (0.0000°, 0.0000°). Address fields are only provided to the nearest hundred block in order to maintain privacy. This data is as accurate as the data in the database. Please note questions or concerns in the comments.

In 24 hour military time  -  Time person was booked at a detention facility.

Find LAPD Reporting Districts on the LA City GeoHub at http://geohub.lacity.org/datasets/lapd-reporting-districts?geometry=-121.023%2C33.621%2C-115.797%2C34.418

The 21 Geographic Areas or Patrol Divisions are also given a name designation that references a landmark or the surrounding community that it is responsible for. For example 77th Street Division is located at the intersection of South Broadway and 77th Street, serving neighborhoods in South Los Angeles.
The LAPD has 21 Community Police Stations referred to as Geographic Areas within the department. These Geographic Areas are sequentially numbered from 1-21.
In 24 hour military time.
MM/DD/YYYY

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Census Tracts' (k96s-3jcv) the point in column 'location_1' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'LA Specific Plans' (ur2y-g4cx) the point in column 'location_1' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Zip Codes' (qz3q-ghft) the point in column 'location_1' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Neighborhood Councils (Certified)' (2dna-qi2s) the point in column 'location_1' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Precinct Boundaries' (tatf-ua23) the point in column 'location_1' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council Districts' (kqwf-mjcx) the point in column 'location_1' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
Defines the Crime Code provided. For this dataset - all Traffic Collision.

resource.name: Building and Safety - Electrical Permits Issued from 2020 to Present (N)
resource.description: The Department of Building and Safety issues permits for the construction, remodeling, and repair of buildings and structures in the City of Los Angeles. Permits are categorized into building permits, electrical permits, and mechanical permits (which include plumbing, HVAC systems, fire sprinklers, elevators, and pressure vessels). Depending on the complexity of a project, a permit may be issued the same day with Express Permit or e-Permit ("No Plan Check" category), or a permit may require that the plans be reviewed ("Plan Check" category) by a Building and Safety Plan Check personnel.
